Class ExpressionProcessorUtil

java.lang.Object
br.com.concepting.framework.processors.ExpressionProcessorUtil
public class ExpressionProcessorUtil extends Object
Class responsible to manipulate expressions.

    • fillEnvironmentInString

      public static String fillEnvironmentInString(String value)
      Replaces the environment variables in a string. The resource property should be declared like the following: 
      ${<variable-name>} E.g.: ${JAVA_HOME}
      Parameters:
      value - String before the processing.
      Returns:
      String after the processing.

    • fillVariablesInString

      public static String fillVariablesInString(String value)
      Replaces variables in a string. The variable must be defined like the following: 
      @{<variable-name>} E.g.: @{var1}
      Parameters:
      value - String that will be processed.
      Returns:
      String processed.

    • fillVariablesInString

      public static String fillVariablesInString(String domain, String value)
      Replaces variables in a string. The variable must be defined like the following: 
      @{<variable-name>} E.g.: @{var1}
      Parameters:
      domain - String that contains the identifier of the domain.
      value - String that will be processed.
      Returns:
      String processed.

    • fillVariablesInString

      public static String fillVariablesInString(String value, Locale language)
      Replaces variables in a string. The variable must be defined like the following: 
      @{<variable-name>} E.g.: @{var1}
      Parameters:
      value - String that will be processed.
      language - Instance that contains the language.
      Returns:
      String processed.

    • fillVariablesInString

      public static String fillVariablesInString(String domain, String value, Locale language)
      Replaces variables in a string. The variable must be defined like the following: 
      @{<variable-name>} E.g.: @{var1}
      Parameters:
      domain - String that contains the identifier of the domain.
      value - String that will be processed.
      language - Instance that contains the language.
      Returns:
      String processed.

    • fillVariablesInString

      public static String fillVariablesInString(String domain, String value, boolean replaceNotFoundMatches, Locale language)
      Replaces variables in a string. The variable must be defined like the following: 
      @{<variable-name>} E.g.: @{var1}
      Parameters:
      domain - String that contains the identifier of the domain.
      value - String that will be processed.
      replaceNotFoundMatches - Indicates if the variables that were not found should be replaced with blank.
      language - Instance that contains the language.
      Returns:
      String processed.

    • fillVariablesInString

      public static String fillVariablesInString(String domain, String value, boolean replaceNotFoundMatches, boolean escapeCrlf, Locale language)
      Replaces variables in a string. The variable must be defined like the following: 
      @{<variable-name>} E.g.: @{var1}
      Parameters:
      domain - String that contains the identifier of the domain.
      value - String that will be processed.
      replaceNotFoundMatches - Indicates if the variables that were not found should be replaced with blank.
      escapeCrlf - Indicates if it should escape CRLF in the replacements.
      language - Instance that contains the language.
      Returns:
      String processed.

    • clearVariables

      public static void clearVariables(String domain)
      Clear variables of the domain.
      Parameters:
      domain - String that contains the domain.
